page.title: 18Hedges in N.Upottery
page.content: We still have a great many of these, some of them very old.They are largely hazel and hawthorn,with many other trees and shrubs growing among them:maple,alder,elder,holly,spindle, guelder rose,oak,ash,beech,blackthorn, wild rose,dogwood,privet,but not, alas,elm. Honeysuckle,ivy,bryony and bramble clamber over them,fox-runs traverse them and they are a home and a highway for hedgehogs, voles, shrews, mice,rabbits,stoats and weasels,and they shelter a wealth of bird and insect-life. Many of the hedges are regularly trimmed and laid,but there are some little-used lanes where they are left to grow tall.
